description:
Ramp is building the modern financial stack that enables companies to accelerate growth without compromising on their finances. We’re on a mission to uncover and eliminate waste before it undermines our customer’s goals. We make financial rigor easy by enabling real-time visibility and understanding of every dollar spent.

Ramp was founded by the same team who built, scaled, and sold Paribus to Capital One, enabling automated savings on online purchases and putting over $100 million back in consumers’ pockets every year. We are backed by Founders Fund, Coatue, and Box Group, as well as over 50 founders of leading companies.

About the Role

Ramp is, at its core, an engineering company, and is on a mission to build the best engineering team in NYC! We are looking for frontend and full stack engineering interns (12 weeks) who are excited to be part of our early story and help us build a diverse and vibrant tech community in the city. We hire engineers with a broad set of technical skills, who are highly cross-functional, and eager to solve a wide range of engineering challenges. Our ideal candidate has a strong sense of ownership and enjoys owning projects from inception to scaling it in production. We value people who take pride in their work, and show an aptitude for learning quickly whether they’re familiar with our stack or not. As an early employee, you'll be working with a nimble team of committed and talented engineers and having a large, long-term impact on technical design and engineering culture.

What You'll Do

  • Build performant, beautiful, and usable interfaces that solve for growing businesses with complex needs
  • Ship products and services in cross-functional teams
  • Work with sales and business teams to incorporate and productize customer feedback
  • Help establish engineering process, tools, and systems that will allow us to scale the code base, productivity, and the team

What You'll Need

  • Currently pursuing a B.S. (or higher) in Computer Science or a related technical field, with an expected graduation date in 2021 or 2022
  • Proficiency in Javascript, with a knack for getting the visuals right
  • Experience with one or more object-oriented programming languages
  • Track record of shipping high quality products and features or a portfolio of side projects
  • Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions
  • Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
  • Alignment with Ramp’s core values of enabling businesses to grow more by spending less

Nice to Haves

  • Proficiency in React v16+
  • Familiarity with or desire to learn our tech stack which includes, but not limited to: Flask (Python), Elixir, AWS, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL
  • Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology

About Our Teams

  • Card Engineering | Ramp’s Card Engineering team is responsible for shipping products with a singular focus on enhancing the finance team and cardholder experience. Current project areas include accounting, physical/virtual card management, mobile wallets, transactions, reimbursements, spend insights, and vendor/invoice management.
  • Risk Engineering | Ramp’s Risk Engineering team is pioneering how risk is evaluated and building the infrastructure to scale to millions of business in the United States. Current project areas include application processing, underwriting & KYC, risk data signals, risk limit & exposure management, bank linking, capital markets, fraud, and payments.

Learn more about our problem space and environment at our new engineering blog - https://engineering.ramp.com

Ramp Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO
  • WFH stipend to support your home office needs
  • Monthly wellness stipend

Position Title: Internship

Location: Westford, MA

Position Summary:

This role will be a part of the Technical Analytics Practice within the Sales Engineering organization. The primary responsibility of this team is to make sure that all account facing teams have the tools, support and information that they need to propose a solution and to provide guidance and expertise in making sure that proposals are driven forward with customers with appropriate architecture and construction. This team is also tasked with making sure that all demos, trials, and proof-of-concept activities are properly resourced and executed to gain customer confidence and complete the sale.

This role is intended to develop tools to be used internally to understand the sales pipeline, product success areas/where to expand, and to automate tools for use in the sales process. In addition, the candidate will develop an AWS based demo environment for all Ribbon Analytics products. This will include deploying both Ribbon Analytics and software based Ribbon SBCs/etc. to be used in product demonstrations. Candidate will be tasked with developing life-like scenarios that show the power of Ribbon Analytics, and work with the sales team to deliver a compelling demonstration environment. In addition, the candidate will own the AWS environment and be tasked with all aspects of system maintenance, recovery, etc. The candidate will also explore the possibility of making the demonstration environment usable for customer Proof of Concept testing. This will include customer data anonymization, ingestion, processing, and POC execution.

As a full understanding of the Ribbon Analytics product portfolio is achieved, the candidate would also be expected to assist in the development of advanced features for implementation by CTO and engineering teams.
Required Experience:


  • Currently enrolled in Computer Science, Data Science, or related degree program. Concentration in Networking a plus
  • Experience working through all analytics phases such as data understanding, data preparation, data engineering, data modeling, business intelligence and closed-loop automation
  • Experience modeling and deploying AI/ML algorithms using standard modeling tools or programming languages
  • Ability to develop in Python, Java, and/or scripting languages
  • Strong understanding of databases (SQL and/or NoSQL)

Please Note:

US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply.

position: High School SRI - Human-Earth Systems Sci:Develop Intern [Remote] Academic
description:
Organization and Job ID

Job ID: 312166

Directorate: Earth and Biological Sciences

Division: Joint Global Change Research Institute

Group: Human-Earth Systems Science: Development

Job Description

Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is seeking ambitious, high-caliber junior or senior high school students for intern assignment within the High School Student Research Intern (HS SRI) Program. This internship provides an opportunity for students interested in preparing for careers in science, technology, engineering or mathematics (STEM - or Computer Science) to work during the academic year with a scientist/mentor in a specified research area. Students attend regular classes in their school for one-half day.

The student's primary area of work will be with an existing database on soil respiration (the natural flow of CO2 from the soil to atmosphere) studies made worldwide. After an extensive orientation period, the student will update the database with recently-published data. This is more than simple data entry and requires careful reading and checking in collaboration with the two primary mentors, Dr. Ben Bond-Lamberty and Ms. Stephanie Pennington. Work later in this year will branch out to R programming and data visualization.

*BEFORE YOU APPLY*

When asked to upload your resume to your application, you need to upload one (1) PDF file that includes the following:

Cover Letter

Resume

Unofficial transcript

Personal Statement: Describe who you are beyond your academic achievements and potential. Offer information in regards to what kind of activities, leadership or experiences you’ve had that contributed toward your interest in STEM.

APPLICATIONS THAT DO NOT INCLUDE THE ITEMS ABOVE IN THEIR SINGLE PDF UPLOAD WILL BE DISQUALIFIED AS INCOMPLETE.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Applicants must be currently enrolled as a sophomore, junior, or senior in a public or private high school.

  • Applicants must be 16 years of age by August 2021.

  • Applicants must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher (from beginning of 9th grade to current standing).

Preferred Qualifications

Relevant Course Work - Background in high school earth sciences and computer science.

Computer Skills Desired - Programming experience at a high school level.

Other Desired Skills - Good communication skills. C++, R, and/or Git experience is useful.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital or family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. Los Angeles based Internet Brands is looking for a Quality Assurance Intern to be part of the QA team. This position has great potential for learning and advancement.

Quality Assurance Interns will be responsible for executing black box testing on a number of web-based projects under the guidance of senior QA team members. They will be trained in the company’s Quality Assurance process and be given opportunities to contribute to the creation of test cases and scripts.

The ideal candidate will have a background in computer science, meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and strong written and verbal communication skills. A degree in Computer Science or web development experience is strongly encouraged, but is not required. Prior quality assurance experience or software development experience is a plus.

Responsibilities:
  • Executing black box tests on all web-based and desktop application-based products.
  • Executing and help develop automated test cases.
  • Identifying issues and generating issue reports.
  • Reproducing customer-reported issues.
  • Assisting developers with issue analysis.
  • Developing automated test scripts.
  • Actively participating in test case design and script maintenance.
  • Verification of patches and bug fixes.
  • Interfacing closely with programmers and other QA engineers.

Qualifications:
  • An understanding of web-delivered applications.
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or other web development languages.
  • Familiarity with multiple web browsers (Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Chrome, etc.)
  • Experience with Microsoft Office (Word & Excel).
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills within a team environment.
  • A Bachelors of Science degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or enrollment in one of these majors, is a plus but not required.
  • Experience working in a web development company is a plus.
  • Software development experience is a plus.
  • Software quality assurance experience is a plus.

Are you looking for more?

At Mohawk Industries, we’re committed to more – more customer solutions, more process improvements, more sustainable manufacturing and more opportunities for our team.


As a Fortune 500, global flooring leader with some of the best-known brands in the industry, Mohawk is a great place to start or develop your career with an emphasis on more of what’s important to you. Whether you want to lead more, innovate more, learn more or create more, you can find your more with Mohawk.


Who we Are:

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Our industry-leading innovation has yielded products and technologies that differentiate our brands in the marketplace and satisfy remodeling and new construction requirements. We are in search of Difference Makers to help us innovate solutions that floor the imagination of our customers; while providing value to their lives. We’re redefining flooring with products that not only minimize climate impact but also foster beauty and allow people to connect and thrive. If you would like to make a direct impact with a multi-billion Fortune 500 global leader in flooring fashions; while making the world a better place, then we have an exciting opportunity for you!


Program Overview:

Each intern is presented a real business challenge within their group that provides the opportunity to exchange ideas with subject matter experts for optimal learning and development that leads to real solutions. At the end of the summer, our interns get together to showcase their awesome accomplishments during an event we call the “Intern Expo”. But we aren’t ALL business, throughout the summer our University Relations team hosts exclusive events such as featured executive lunch & learns, plant tours, personal & professional development sessions and intern socials.

Your Role:

As an Engineering Intern you will be working with controls and automation to design projects and parts to machinery. You will also work with a local automation team on implementing control upgrades, automation improvements, and recommend capital investments.


Qualifications:

  • Enrolled in an accredited Bachelor’s degree program in Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial Engineering, or Computer Science
  • Minimum 2.7 GPA
  • Completed freshman year of courses

Preferred Skills:

  • General understanding of programming logic and automation

Perks & Benefits:

As an intern at Mohawk you can look forward to competitive pay, paid holidays off, potential relocation/housing assistance based on work location and employee discounts on Mohawk products and many others.

  • Position requires unrestricted work authorization in the United States; work/visa sponsorship for this position is not available.

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Mohawk’s vertically integrated manufacturing and distribution processes provide competitive advantages in the production of carpet, rugs, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone and vinyl flooring. Our industry-leading innovation has yielded products and technologies that differentiate our brands in the marketplace and satisfy all remodeling and new construction requirements. Our brands are among the most recognized in the industry and include American Olean, Daltile, Durkan, IVC, Karastan, Marazzi, Mohawk, Mohawk Home, Pergo, and Quick-Step. During the past decade, Mohawk has transformed its business from an American carpet manufacturer into the world’s largest flooring company with operations in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Europe, India, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Russia and the United States.

Build your career at Buildertrend, ranked #1 in Best Places to Work in Omaha 2019, 2020 & 2021!


Buildertrend is looking for a UX Research Intern who will help elevate the practice of research with creative but rigorous qualitative, quantitative, and/or design research methods. The right candidate will be an effective communicator, passionate about understanding people, curious about the relationship between data, technology and society, comfortable in a flat, fast-moving organization, and a great collaborator. You will help with large research projects (generative and evaluative) and support the research efforts of the larger product team of designers, product analysts, and developers.


Responsibilities


  • Schedule, conduct, and document research interviews to learn more about our customers and how to best improve their experiences
  • Conduct research studies by applying methods such as usability testing, interviews, field research, surveys, and diary studies
  • Design and execute studies that address both user behavior and attitudes, using the right methodology for the right questions
  • Work closely with product teams, as well as other researchers, to identify important research questions
  • Generate insights that shape how product teams think about medium and long-term product strategy
  • Work cross-functionally with design, product, data science, content strategy, engineering, and marketing
  • Combining qualitative and quantitative customer insights to generate strategic and tactical insights along with actionable recommendations
  • Communicate insights in creative and compelling ways
  • Comfort with utilizing data to define and support hypotheses


Minimum Qualification


  • Current junior, senior, or graduate student in a human behavior-related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Anthropology, Information Science, Computer Science, Political Science, or Design
  • Knowledge of research methods in at least one subset of methods (e.g., survey design and quantitative data analysis, ethnography) - qualitative and/or quantitative research (Preferred)
  • Analytical, project management, and problem-solving experience
  • Experience with autonomy and independent decision making to weigh tradeoffs and balance demands
  • Experience with Excel (and the ability to quickly learn new tools)
  • Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

From Estimating, Scheduling, and Change Order features to Client Communication and Document Management tools, our feature set is here to streamline every aspect of the construction process. As a partner in our customers’ success, our team provides unmatched support, every step of the way. Applecart is a high growth marketing technology company based in New York City, founded in 2013. Applecart has developed a proprietary social graph platform that uses publicly available data to map over 25 billion social relationships between more than 250 million adult Americans. Applecart's platform helps major corporations, national nonprofit organizations, and high-profile political campaigns with their highest stakes marketing challenge: reaching hard-to-reach audiences of decision makers, spanning corporate executives, legislators, regulators, investors, members of the media, and more.

For years, marketing technology businesses have focused on solving b2c (consumer) marketing challenges (e.g. look-a-like modeling to find new customers), but the traditional pay-per-impression advertising model has left a massive opportunity unsolved for: how to market when a company's target isn't the average consumer, but is instead a single, senior decision maker. Applecart is the solution to this problem for some of the world's most prominent organizations.

Quick facts about us:
Applecart has generated over $30M in revenue, with annual revenues in excess of $10M.

Our senior leadership team includes two members of the 2021 Forbes 30 under 30 list for Marketing and Advertising, a former senior White House advisor, one of the earliest sales leaders at Google and Twitter, and two of the Democratic Party's most successful pollsters and strategists

Our investors include global sports, entertainment and marketing giant Endeavor, KKR Co-Chairman and Co-CEO Henry Kravis, entrepreneur Chris Burch, a founder of Palantir, senior engineering leaders at Twitter and Yelp, past CEOs of Fortune 50 companies and a number of well-known venture capitalists. Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel is a board member of the company.

Current and past clients include Blackstone, Boeing, KKR, the Environmental Defense Fund, the Business Roundtable, Governor John Kasich, Congressman Conor Lamb and Republican Voters Against Trump.

Our work has been featured on Morning Joe on MSNBC, Bloomberg and The Colbert Report, and in Axios, BusinessWeek, the Associated Press, Forbes, the Washington Post, and Politico, among many others.

About the Role

We are looking for creative, self-motivated, flexible thinkers to join our team as a Data Analyst Intern . Working with Applecart's political strategists, data analysts, and data scientists, the Data Analyst Fellow will contribute to targeting, analytics, and polling efforts on behalf of some of the country's most prominent trade associations, political campaigns, non-profits, independent expenditure efforts, and corporations.

About the Role

We are looking for creative, self-motivated, flexible thinkers to join our rapidly growing start-up as an Analyst Intern. Working with Applecart's political strategists, data analysts, and data scientists, you will assume meaningful responsibilities to help meet client needs, execute on their own research projects, and play a large role in helping our clients win campaigns.

What You Will Do

Assist in general, ongoing campaign activities
Explore Applecart's current and past projects to produce analyses and associated learnings
Build insight-rich reports for both our clients and internally within the company
Draft political polls to effectively measure public opinion about specific issues or candidates
Assist in the development of proposal and pitch materials for prospective clients
Build case studies of current and past campaign successes
Research developments in political news, political science (including research into political candidates, the histories of certain political geographies, and the academic literature of modern political campaigns), and political polling
Develop your technical skills and gain a deeper understanding of statistics

Education and Experience

You are currently enrolled in, or a recent graduate from, a BA/BS or MA/MS program at a four-year college or university in political science, public policy, statistics, computer science, economics, or a related field
You have previously worked on a small team and successfully completed time-sensitive, detail-oriented projects

Qualifications

You work well with a small team in a fast-paced, self-motivated environment
You have exceptionally strong written and verbal communication skills
You maintain a particularly sharp attention to detail
You are comfortable and confident in problem-solving as a team and autonomously
You have a passion for American politics and an interest in the nuts and bolts of political campaigns; self-proclaimed political junkies welcome!

You are open to working with solutions-oriented candidates and causes on both sides of the political aisle
You want to understand and execute using data-driven decision making

Preferred Qualifications

You have worked on a political campaign or conducted political research
You have quantitative work experience
You are familiar with a programming language; SQL and/or Python a plus

Logistical Details

Internship terms: Summer or Fall 202
This is a paid internship program

position: SAP Ariba iXp Intern - Full Stack Developer
description:
Requisition ID: 276489
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:

1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:
The Supply Chain Collaboration team is one of the fastest growing teams within the SAP Business Network, the largest business-to-business network in the world with over 3.6 million connected companies in over 190 countries. Our solution enables customers to manage and run an efficient supply chain and helps them collaborate with direct materials suppliers through innovative planning and execution processes. We are looking for bright engineers who are passionate about solving complex business problems with purposeful and beautiful software and have fun while doing it.


What you’ll do:

Position Title: SAP Ariba iXp Intern – Full Stack Developer
Location: Palo Alto, CA
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 – August 2021


In this role, you’ll:
  • Have the unique opportunity to work on innovation/prototyping projects that will enhance the Supply Chain Collaboration offering
  • Design and develop pixel-perfect UI, robust APIs, and scalable microservices for the cloud
  • Gain insight in how enterprise customers manage and run their supply chain on the SAP Business Network


Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
  • Strong desire to revolutionize the enterprise application space by building beautiful and purposeful cloud solutions for business users
  • Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, ability to articulate technical challenges and solutions clearly
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with Angular, Microservices (Springboot), Kafka, JIRA, IntelliJ IDEA, JMeter, Jenkins, Github


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Backend Software Developer - Intern

Amply Power is a clean energy technology company going after an emerging $100B market opportunity. AMPLY deploys and operates EV chargers the way data centers operate server blades - lots of them at a time, with high efficiency, low cost, and 99.99% uptime. We serve public sector and commercial businesses with fleet vehicles - electric buses, trucks, and passenger fleets. Amply Power is focused on transforming the commercial transportation sector by removing the challenges, surprises, and learning curve that fleet operators often face when switching to electricity as a fuel.

We’re looking for product-oriented engineers who are passionate about building great backend services in a fast-paced, high-growth, early-stage start-up environment. Our engineers are encouraged to be autonomous, solving open-ended problems and maximizing their own growth. The Backend Software Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining the software that runs on our electric vehicle charging stations and for the interfaces between stations and cloud-based services.

While this posting is listed for SF Bay Area, CA, we are open to hiring throughout the US.

description:

description:
Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

At Siemens Healthineers, we are passionate about enabling healthcare professionals to deliver high quality patient care, and to do so affordably. A leading global healthcare company, Siemens Healthineers continues to strengthen our portfolio of medical imaging and laboratory diagnostics, while adding new offerings such as managed services, consulting, and healthcare IT services – as well as further technologies in the growing market for therapeutic and molecular diagnostics.

Siemens Healthineers develops innovations that support better patient outcomes with greater efficiencies, giving providers the confidence, they need to meet the clinical, operational and financial challenges of a changing healthcare landscape. Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments – creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them.
You have an opportunity to personally thrive, make a difference and be part of a culture where individuality is noticed and valued every day.

THE CONDUENT DIFFERENCE
We manage interactions with patients and the insured for a significant portion of the U.S. healthcare industry. We are the customer interface for large segments of the technology industry and the operational and processing partner of choice for public transportation systems around the world.

INNOVATION THROUGH CO-CREATION
Fueled by an innovative mindset and an entrepreneurial culture, we constantly find new ways to create unique value for our clients. Every day we engage in relentless pursuit of greater solutions to improve the lives of citizens, patients and employees around the world.

Whether its digital payments, claims processing, benefit administration, automated tolling, customer care or distributed learning - Conduent manages and modernizes these interactions to create value for both our clients and their constituents. Learn more at www.conduent.com.

description:
United States

Position Description

Volvo Group Trucks Technology (GTT), a division of Volvo Group North America, provide state-of-the-art research, engineering, product planning and project execution to final delivery of complete vehicles.

Position Description Summary:
We are currently looking for a motivated and self-driven student to work within our Testing Technology department during the summer. Testing Technology is a department within Features, Verification and Validation (FVV), a group that works with testing and simulation of Complete Vehicles for Volvo Trucks and Mack Trucks in North America. The student should be prepared to work in a challenging and fast-paced environment; gaining experience and knowledge in various aspects of engineering. As a valued member of the Testing Technology Group within GTT, the student will have the opportunity to work directly with the Volvo Trucks Test Engineers. GTT’s goal is to contribute to the student’s development, as well as providing an opportunity for the student to work in a business environment within the manufacturing industry. This position will report directly to the Testing Technology Group Manager.

Core Responsibilities:
  • The candidate will have a mentor assigned to them and oversee their daily tasks and provide required support throughout the semester
  • The candidate will work directly with the data analytics engineers focusing on the following items:
  • Development of internal planning tool for resource allocation and visualization in VBA
  • Database querying and support development internal asset tracking tool for test equipment
  • Setup and configuration of custom-made Power BI dashboards according to internal requests
  • Assist test engineers with script conversion from Matlab to Python
  • Support development of internal Field Test Python Library in collaboration with data analytic engineers
  • Support development and tracking of data quality and data movement dashboard
  • It is preferable that the candidate have experience with the following:
  • Matlab, Python, SQL, VBA, Power BI or any other scripting language
  • Microsoft Office Suite
  • Previous experience with time series data from measurement sensors
  • Basic understanding of data report generation and visualization.

Duration:
This internship will require 30 hours per week during the fall semester 2021. Interns will be expected to spend a large part of the time working in the Greensboro shop/office. However, due to the unpredictable nature of the ongoing pandemic, the manager may approve the intern to work a portion of their time from home. This internship will require location in Greensboro, NC for the duration of the internship.
Internship will run from August through December, 2021.

Essential Skills and Required Experience:
  • Applicant must be currently enrolled and pursuing a Computer Science or similar degree and have completed 30 semester hours of undergraduate studies prior to the start of the internship
  • Applicants must have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 at the time of application
  • Ability to generate source code and scripts including troubleshooting of existing applications
  • Previous experience developing data reports and dashboards
  • Great problem-solving skills and a basic understanding of automotive is preferred
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work in teams

  • Valid US Work authorization
Personal Competencies:
  • Service oriented mindset
  • Team player with the ability to adjust to new situations and stakeholder needs
  • Ability to work effectively with peers from all areas of the organization
  • Works with integrity and instills trust
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
  • Engaged and proactively seeks knowledge
  • Ability to use various mechanic tools and lift up to 30 lbs

About us

The Volvo Group drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers’ uptime and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Countless career opportunities are offered across the group’s leading brands - Volvo, Volvo Penta, Terex Trucks, SDLG, Renault Trucks, Prevost, Nova Bus, Mack, Eicher, Dongfeng Trucks and Arquus.

Volvo Group Trucks Technology provides Volvo Group Trucks and Business Area's with state-of-the-art research, cutting-edge engineering, product planning and purchasing services, as well as aftermarket product support. With Volvo Group Trucks Technology you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.

description:
Job Description:


About Ribbon (Nasdaq: RBBN)

We deliver global real-time communications software and network solutions to service providers, enterprises, and critical infrastructure sectors. We engage deeply with our customers, helping them modernize their networks for improved competitive positioning and business outcomes in today’s smart, always-on and data-hungry world. Our innovative, end-to-end solutions portfolio delivers unparalleled scale, performance, agility and automation and includes optical and packet networking, core to edge IP solutions, UCaaS/ CPaaS cloud offers, and leading-edge software security and analytics tools.

To learn more, visit rbbn.com

Position Title: Solutions Engineer Internship

Location: Plano, TX or Raleigh, NC

Position Summary:

The Solutions Engineer Intern will support assigned Sales and Sales Engineering teams and will learn how to articulate both the technology and value proposition of Ribbon IP and Optical products. This intern position is a great career step for anyone interested in technical sales or sales engineering in IP or Optical fields.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Assist Sales and Sales Engineering by responding to functional and technical questions on RFIs/RFPs.
  • Aid in the delivery of technical and business presentations on Ribbon’s product and solutions portfolio.
Required Experience:

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Excellent organizational skills.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to convey technical details both verbally and in writing.
  • Proficient with MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Understanding of IP, MPLS, and various routing protocols.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
  • Current enrollment in a Computer Science or Electrical Engineering undergraduate or graduate degree program.

Please Note:

'All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.'

US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply.
From: Ribbon Communications

The Position:

We are looking for current Computer Science or Computer Engineering students to join one of our software development teams in Tampa, Florida for an internship. If you are a current student or a student taking a gap year due to COVID and are interested in designing and building unique security software that no one else is building, then this exciting opportunity is for you. As part of a larger team, you will be given project-oriented work helping develop professional cybersecurity solutions used to protect critical infrastructure around the world. You will get exposure to every stage of the software development lifecycle, planning, design, coding, testing, and deployment amongst other stages.


What You Will Be Doing:

  • Project oriented hands on coding assignments and professional development activities
  • Using latest cloud and on-premise technology stacks
  • Contributing to the design and architecture of the solutions you work on
  • Enhancing the automation testing framework to achieve test driven development
  • Starting your career as a software engineer under the mentorship of experienced team members


What We Need From You:

  • A passion for Cyber security and learning
  • Progress toward a Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, or a related major
  • Examples of extracurricular programing projects (e.g. on Github)
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills


About OPSWAT

OPSWAT is a global leader in critical infrastructure cybersecurity that helps protect the world's mission-critical organizations from malware and zero-day attacks. To minimize the risk of compromise, OPSWAT Critical Infrastructure Protection (CIP) solutions enable both public and private organizations to implement processes that ensure the secure transfer of files and devices to and from critical networks. In total, 98% of U.S. nuclear power facilities and more than 1,000 organizations worldwide spanning Financial Services, Defense, Manufacturing, Energy, Aerospace, Transportation Systems trust OPSWAT to secure their files and devices; ensure compliance with industry and government-driven policies and regulations, and to protect their reputations, finances, employees, and relationships from cyber-driven disruption. For more information, visit www.opswat.com.

To apply for this position, please send your resume and cover letter to us via JobScore. Special consideration will be given to those candidates whose cover letter indicates that they have viewed our website. Please, no drop-ins, calls, or faxes.

To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring groundbreaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, and artist in the world.

position: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
description:
Requisition ID: 286555
Work Area: Software-Development Operations
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Project:


The SAP Internship Experience Project is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP:


  • Culture of collaboration:     Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Project in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:


The SAP Digital Platforms team, within SAP’s Intelligence Enterprise Solutions group, is responsible for SAP.com and associated external (public-facing) digital web properties. The SAP Digital Platforms team is responsible for the development lifecycle, continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices, and overall operational support for 47 country sites globally in 23 languages.


The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is a detail-oriented, in-house services team that is constantly pushing the envelope by working within our creative and technical boundaries to encourage internal customers to build the best user-experiences and blazing-fast websites.


What you’ll do:


Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected start date to end date: June - December 2021


In this role, you’ll:


The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is looking for an Intern to assist the Speed Performance Monitoring Lead to collaborate with the design, development, and other operational leads for SAP‘s digital landscapes. Our on-going objective to improve the online responsiveness of our user-experience on desktop and mobile web browsers in support of SAP’s 2021 Mobile-First strategy.


This role is responsible for assisting in the management of SAP.com and other digital entities including communications, content and assets for various areas of the global website and digital programs. The position provides a main point of contact for assigned requests, driving projects to completion through close collaboration with core platform team members, leadership, and assigned third-party agencies to ensure efficient and timely production of a high-quality digital customer experience.


Who you are:


We're looking for a self-motivated, out-of-the-box thinker who enjoys challenges across a broad range of technology subject areas, is pursuing a career in Computer Science, Front-End Web Development, or User-Experience Design with knowledge and interest in performance and optimization, front-end development, interactive design, application performance industry, and enterprise level projects.


Responsibilities


  • Audit websites for performance, identify optimization opportunities, and present the results in the cross-functional team environment.
  • Work in a collaborative environment developing and executing against immediate and long-term incremental programs.
  • Make effective tradeoffs considering business priorities, but always with the user-experience in mind.
  • Advise web engineering teams on key technical performance and optimization considerations and best practices.
  • Work with Data/Analytics team on ensure assets are trackable for reporting and insights initiatives.
  • Profile performance of JavaScript and layouts for a multitude of devices/platforms.
  • Work with partners (e.g.: Adobe, Splunk, Google, and other third-party web services) and consulting agencies to ensure each site release or initiative delivers maximum impact to customers across all websites and data platforms.
  • Generate performance reports, competitive analysis, and benchmarks for internal partners using our best-in-class performance and optimization tool-sets.
  • Build out and report on synthetic tests with Splunk (a.k.a. Rigor) Synthetic Testing platform.
  • Build out available real-user monitoring test reports with SAP.com Development Team.
  • Analyze performance metrics and build plans for improvements with development leads.
  • Provide an unparalleled customer experience by contributing to new features and technical documentation.
  • Assist with discovering and debugging issues found on web properties.
  • Find areas we can optimistically render UI without waiting on a server response.
  • Police and standardize performance budgets, health-checks, scorecards, and KPIs directed by your main point of contact.
  • Monitor and measure complex multi-step user flows on our customers’ websites and applications using a full browser and a script recorder.
  • Track mobile and desktop experiences and performance over time using pre-determined, industry standard network connections.
  • Monitor and optimize third-party tags and identify slow and error-causing external script risks.
  • Run tests with highly customizable configurations on any device type, connection speed or viewport
  • Develop, share, and set the bar within SAP for high quality in web performance engineering.
  • Assist in the support of planning and project management.
  • Assist building internal webpages in SAP JAM, Microsoft Teams, and other wiki-based platforms for documentation and communication in support of SAP’s Speed Performance Monitoring program.
  • Help organize projects in accordance with requirements.
  • Assist with SAP.com agile ceremonies and planning.
  • Leverage tools and technology for SAP.com content and asset production.
  • Have very good communication skills and enjoy communicating challenging technical concepts.
  • Measure and A/B test site performance solutions.
  • Mentor, educate and advocate for web performance across our teams.


Qualifications


  • General knowledge of web speed performance metrics.
  • General familiarity with Internet technologies and how the web works.
  • General knowledge of industry standard web speed performance tools; e.g.: WebPageTest.org, Google Pagespeed Insights, and Google Lighthouse.
  • General to Intermediate knowledge, approx. 1-2 years, of general web technologies experience; e.g.: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Java/C#/PHP.
  • Intermediate knowledge of Google Core Web Vitals strategy and metric threshold requirements.
  • Intermediate knowledge of visual design principles and commonly used tools for optimizing visual page elements; e.g.: images and media.
  • Have the ability to read and understand code, explore new technologies, and APIs.
  • General knowledge of modern browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
  • General knowledge of project management and, issue tracking and documentation tools; e.g.: JIRA, Confluence, MS Teams, Slack, etc.
  • Proficiency with converting JSON to MS Excel for in-depth speed performance reporting.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs; including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Comfortable working with a geographically-distributed software development team.
  • Willingness to acquire new skills to meet evolving needs.
  • Passion and interest in web performance optimization to improve an website’s user-experience across all web devices, internet connection speeds, and geo-locations.
  • Exceptional organizational and planning skills and a proven ability to multi-task.
  • General knowledge of Agile methodologies.
  • General understanding of content management systems such as WordPress or Adobe AEM.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills.
  • Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy and quality.
  • Ability to prioritize effectively to manage multiple projects.
  • Experience working in a team environment as well as independently.
  • Ability to collaborate across teams globally.
  • Ability to complete tasks in a timely manner.
  • Strong desire to continually learn new technologies.


Technical Experience


A basic knowledge is required for this internship.

Intermediate expertise is required for future employment opportunities.

  • Full-stack Development
  • HTML5/CSS3
  • JavaScript
  • JavaScript Frameworks
  • jQuery
  • DevTools
  • Responsive/Adaptive Design
  • Cross-Browser Development
  • Content Management Systems
  • Testing/Debugging
  • Git/Version Control
  • Bonus Skills:
    • Solid hands-on understanding of Google Analytics, CDNs and custom HTTP headers.
    • Intermediate knowledge of advanced web performance profiling tools; e.g.: GTmetrix, Pingdom, SpeedCurve, Rigor, etc.
    • Experience optimizing React applications.
    • Knowledge of code splitting and simplification methods.


Education and Professional Experience


  • In pursuit of degree in a related field or equivalent work experience; such topics of interests are:
    • Computer Science
    • Web Performance Analytics
    • Full Stack Web Development
    • Front-End Web Development
    • User-Experience Design
    • Interactive Design and Media
    • Marketing & Business
  • Relevant experience in study or similar position managing production processes and workflow.
  • Relevant experience in study or similar position monitoring quality assurance testing environments and live production systems.


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

KION North America Corporation is a member of KION GROUP AG, the world's second largest manufacturer of industrial trucks. We manufacture, deliver and support the best industrial trucks and warehouse technology available to help businesses increase efficiency and profitability. Our brand companies include Linde, STILL, Baoli and Dematic. Headquartered in Summerville, S.C. we produce material handling equipment known for their innovative technologies, reduced energy consumption and low operating costs.
Our Sales Development team is looking for a Business Intelligence Intern to support the implementation of our growth strategy. Reliable and accurate market information will be key to a successful execution of KION’s growth plan in North America. The Business Intelligence Intern will work closely with the Business Analyst.
Pay Rate: $20/hr.
Here's what you can expect:
Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at KION North America is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
We are interested in furthering our data visualization and analysis practices, so you will be responsible for building and maintaining business intelligence solutions from the ground up. We'll need you to gather, analyze, and visualize data with the end goal of maximizing profits and increasing our efficiency. You'll be responsible for processing several different types of data, including those related to our internal sales and industry trends

Our openings are for undergraduate level students who will be given the opportunity to engage in practical research to further their educational goals. The selected interns will provide technical and/or research support to projects in the areas of computational science, cyber defense, computer science, numerical methods, mathematics, or other related fields.

In this role you will:

Security Clearance

LLNL is a Department of Energy (DOE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Laboratory. Most positions will require a DOE L or Q clearance (please reference Security Clearance requirement). If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. An L or Q clearance requires U.S. citizenship. If you hold multiple citizenships (U.S. and another country), you may be required to renounce your non-U.S. citizenship before a DOE L or Q clearance will be processed/granted. For additional information please see DOE Order 472.2.

Equal Employment Opportunity

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please submit a request via our online form.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

  • Ability to provide exceptional client service, demonstrate commitment to continuous learning, display appropriate ethical knowledge and commitment and exhibit a sense of urgency and commitment to quality and the timely completion of duties
  • The ability to work effectively in a team environment with all levels of client personnel in various industries
  • Excellent written/verbal communications and collaboration skills
  • Relevant internship, work experience and/or involvement with a professional organization
  • Be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship as a full-time employee
qualifications: Eligible to work in the U.S

description:
Marketing/Advertising Summer Intern

Jun 2, 2021, 16:44 PM
Title : Marketing/Advertising Summer Intern
Department : Marketing
City : Watertown
Country : United States
Department : Marketing
State : CT

The Siemon Company is looking for a qualified intern to join our marketing/advertising team. Siemon is an industry leader in the design and manufacture of high quality, high performance IT infrastructure solutions and services for Data Centers, Intelligent Buildings and Enterprise LANs. Our marketing department is growing and seeks an intern who can participate in various stages of digital sales & marketing campaigns.

This intern should be prepared to work in a fast-paced team environment and will finish the internship having gained broad experience in various aspects of marketing.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in the creation of signage, circulars, mockups, e-mail campaigns, online promotion, etc.

  • Assist in the distribution or delivery of marketing materials

  • Assist with fulfillment of marketing offers

  • Assist in database acquisition and administrative needs

  • Assist with execution of trade shows (in-person and virtual) + internal events

  • Assist with the preparation and delivery of training materials

  • Perform analysis of marketing and sales data

  • Seek and analyze competitor marketing and sales materials both on and offline

  • Prepare presentations

  • Enter contact information into contact management systems

  • Provide support to social media efforts

  • Maintain tracking report of public relations activity

Requirements

The Siemon Company is looking for an undergraduate student in the greater Watertown, CT area who is majoring in Sales, Marketing or Advertising. This person should have excellent verbal and written communication skills, with extensive knowledge of Web and social media. PowerPoint, Word and Excel experience is a bonus, and will be considered when choosing the best applicant for this internship position.

Majors

Marketing, Sales, Advertising, Computer Science, Mathematics, Language

Summary

Ascend is seeking motivated students to join IT Field Support teams in our Chocolate Bayou manufacturing location. Interns will help run Service Desk operations during a 6-12 month, hands on internship. Interns will have the opportunity to apply functional skills and safety principles in a manufacturing environment while working on projects under the guidance and assistance of experienced team members. These projects may include process improvement, identifying and troubleshooting issues and/or updating procedures. Through these hands on experiences, interns will further develop their skill set and build relationships with IT professionals.

To be eligible, candidates must be enrolled in an accredited college or university and preferably with a 36 semester hours in a Computer Science or related discipline. They must be in good academic standing and have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. Students must have reliable transportation to and from the site daily. Housing is not provided.

This position requires strong interpersonal skills and drive for customer satisfaction. The successful candidate must be able to follow direction, ask for clarification, demonstrate business aptitude, solid analytical and problem solving skills. They must have good written and verbal communication skills, and be able to learn and adapt with new technologies.

Successful completion of the internship program will follow with a presentation to the team and fellow interns. The presentation will include an overview of what the intern learned from the program, the projects worked, and the intern’s overall experience.

Key Responsibilities

  • Act as initial contact for all customer support requests relating to hardware and software, telephone, network, operating systems, printing, and Internet access problems
  • Answer help desk phone, take the first level corrective action
  • Assist with problems and schedule sessions to address technical issues reported by customers. Escalate problems appropriately.
  • Record, track and document problem resolutions
  • Follow up to ensure problem resolution
  • Perform testing to ensure changes meet customer needs
  • Provide technical and administrative support for systems and related applications and services
  • Install, configure, and support workstations and laptops (Windows 7) as well as network printers
  • Perform Asset management via serial number or service tag
  • Perform Printer/copier maintenance
  • Perform Mobile device troubleshooting
  • Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Customer service experience preferred
  • Ability to diagnose and resolve onsite and remote PC related computing problems
  • Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Operating Systems, Microsoft desktop applications and Adobe suite of products
  • Experience with simple network design & support (cable patching, port moves)

Employees in this position must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer; stamina to sit or stand and maintain attention to detail despite interruptions; may occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 25 pounds; may require occasional walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, and/or bending; and vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone. May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat.

Skills Summary:

About Us:

Ascend Performance Materials is the premium provider of high quality chemicals, fibers and plastics. With world scale integrated manufacturing facilities we are able to develop new products from our core technologies, and provide flexibility to respond to the expanding needs of customers. Ascend has global sales and distribution facilities across the globe and six manufacturing facilities globally. As a privately-held company, our people do big things and make big decisions, often much earlier in their careers than at larger companies. Ascend Performance Materials offers team members the opportunity to contribute in big, meaningful ways—all within a stable and growing business.

Why work at Ascend?

Our vision is to be the recognized leader in the nylon 6,6 value chain, creating new possibilities with PA66 for everyone, everywhere, every day. We achieve that through living our Ascend values.

We care . We operate safely with high integrity for our employees, our customers and our communities. Our people are our greatest assets, and our Total Rewards Program extends beyond traditional benefits to include access to on-site medical clinics at our U.S. facilities, a global wellness rewards program and Performance Matters, an employee-driven recognition plan. Our Commitment to Zero demonstrates our belief that is it possible to operate with zero personal injuries, zero process safety incidents and zero environmental releases. And the Ascend Cares Foundation, led by Ascend employees, supports Ascend families in times of need, provides inspiring opportunities for community engagement and facilitates community leadership.

Customer-focused . We exist for our customers; they drive our actions. Their success is our success. Our plastics and chemicals are building blocks that help make everyday essentials safer and more sustainable, and we constantly strive to develop new and innovative products to meet the future needs of our customers. And that customer focus doesn’t only apply to the marketplace – it also applies to how we treat our colleagues and our fellow community members.

Better every day . We invest in our people and our processes to improve every day. A2E, our continuous improvement program, guides the way we do business. And this way of problem solving applies not only to our manufacturing practices but also to our commitment to developing our people. You’ll see it during your career at Ascend in our leadership development, skills training and mentoring programs

Agile . We think broadly and lead proactively in a constantly evolving organization and industry. Agility doesn’t mean simply working quickly – it means critical thinking, creative problem solving and novel approaches to everyday challenges.

One Ascend . All together, with a common set of goals and an eye toward the future. We don’t accept silos. We look for ways to share across departments, sites and geography. This means you won’t be boxed into a single role at Ascend – you could get the chance to work with teams across the globe to improve the way we serve our people, our customers and our communities.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.
